intro: Vulpiella stipoides subsp. stipoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf false foxglove, is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces striking violet to purple flowers in whorled clusters along the stem. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native range.
